column2: COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. On 18 March, the entry requirements to Gibraltar changed. You no longer need to take any COVID-19 tests before you travel or after you arrive in Gibraltar. Entry restrictions apply for travel to Spain. If you are crossing the land border from Gibraltar into Spain you should refer to the Spain travel advice. You can find up to date information on waiting times at the border on the Gibraltar Borders & Coastguard Agency website.
column3:
Self-isolation at own accommodation- subject to categorisation.
On 18 March, the entry requirements to Gibraltar changed.You do not need to fill in a passenger locator form. You do not need to quarantine when you arrive.
The same entry requirements apply whether you are vaccinated or not.See the Gibraltar Tourist Board website for full details of entry requirements to Gibraltar.
column4: Demonstrating your COVID-19 vaccination status. You cannot use a handwritten COVID card as proof of vaccination for travel purposes. The same entry requirements apply whether you are vaccinated or not.See the Gibraltar Tourist Board website for full details of entry requirements to Gibraltar.
column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*All travellers: On 18 March, the entry requirements to Gibraltar changed. You no longer need to take any COVID-19 tests before you travel or after you arrive in Gibraltar. You do not need to fill in a passenger locator form. You do not need to quarantine when you arrive. The same entry requirements apply whether you are vaccinated or not.
See the Gibraltar Tourist Board website for full details of entry requirements to Gibraltar.
*If you’re fully vaccinated: Entry requirements for Gibraltar are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
*Proof of vaccination status: You don’t need to provide proof of your vaccination status for entry to Gibraltar.
*If you’re not fully vaccinated: Entry requirements for Gibraltar are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
*Children and young people: Entry requirements for Gibraltar are the same for all travellers, including children and young people.
*If you’re transiting through Gibraltar: The Gibraltar-Spain border is a busy external Schengen Border and Gibraltar is outside the customs union. There are rules on taking food and drink into the EU, which apply when crossing the border from Gibraltar to Spain.
Entry restrictions apply for travel to Spain. If you are crossing the land border from Gibraltar into Spain you should refer to the Spain travel advice. You can find up to date information on waiting times at the border on the Gibraltar Borders & Coastguard Agency website. Information on the queue is also available by calling +(350) 200 42777, or checking the Gibraltar Frontier website and/or Twitter hashtag #GibFrontier.
*Exemptions: There are no exemptions to the entry requirements to Gibraltar for air passengers.


Internal Restrictions:
*Public places and services: From 4 March the Government of Gibraltar commenced a phased COVID-19 Exit Strategy Plan. On 4 March almost all lockdown restrictions in Gibraltar were lifted. There is no longer a requirement to wear masks, including on public transport. The only locations where the wearing of masks remain mandatory are in Gibraltar Health Authority, Elderly Residential Services and other medical and health service settings (including private providers). *If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
